info.name: Spinal cord, ventral white commissure
info.description: The ventral white commissure of the spinal cord is AKA the anterior white commissure. It is the area of spinal cord white matter immediately ventral or anterior to the spinal canal. It is functionally very important since the ascending nerve fibers of the spinothalamic tract carrying pain and temperature information cross the midline in this commissure.
